channel.title: Fixing the whole/gap in the jaw/face on the players

item.title: Fixing the whole/gap in the jaw/face on the players
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

[quote=“Xx R A G 3 R, post:2, topic:196311”]here use this code if (!Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1)) playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); // Beard else playerProps.writeByte(0); } else { playerProps.writeWord(-1); playerProps.writeWord(npcId); and if your doing this on a Project czar base change !Item. to !Item4.[/quote]

Didn’t work. Btw, I’m using Pimpscape as a starting source right now. Working my way up (I got 100 errors without the bracket again, and with it there I get none and my character, when I log in, is glitched.)

Read full topic

item.title: Fixing the whole/gap in the jaw/face on the players
item.dc:creator: @Scarr Scarr
item.description:
@Scarr wrote:

Well, I have my own code I used. (Please don’t flame this Topic. Oh and I did add it in Player.java above 5 arrays, still didn’t work.)

if (!Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1)) { playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); } // Beard else { playerProps.writeByte(0); } } else { playerProps.writeWord(-1); playerProps.writeWord(npcId); }

Now, before you say “remove the bracket at the end” I already did. Without it there, I get 100 errors. With it there, I get none (in the compiler) when I run the server and log-in my player is spacing out.(all glitchy). Now, I’m not a “noob” coder. I’m an average coder. So I know what I’m doing most of the time on this common-sense stuff. If anyone can help, thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Fixing the whole/gap in the jaw/face on the players
